intro: Chaenorhinum rubrifolium var. flaviflorum, commonly known as the red-leafed yellow-flowered chaenorhinum, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its striking red foliage and bright yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. It produces small, tubular flowers that attract pollinators like bees and butterflies. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is considered a rare and declining species in the wild.
